chabad-of-kathmandu.name: Rabbi Chezky Lifshitz
chabad-of-kathmandu.bio: Chabad emissary who founded and directs Chabad of Nepal in Kathmandu, serving thousands of Israeli backpackers and Jewish travelers annually.

chabad-of-kathmandu.name: Chani Lifshitz
chabad-of-kathmandu.bio: Co-directs Chabad of Kathmandu with her husband, organizing the famous massive Passover seders that attract over 1,000 participants.

chabad-of-kathmandu.name: Rabbi Naftali Lifshitz
chabad-of-kathmandu.bio: Assists in running Chabad of Kathmandu, helping manage the community's services including the large-scale holiday programming.

chabad-of-phnom-penh.name: Rabbi Bentzion Butman
chabad-of-phnom-penh.bio: Chabad emissary who established and runs Chabad of Cambodia in Phnom Penh, providing Jewish services to travelers and expats.

chabad-of-phnom-penh.name: Mashie Butman
chabad-of-phnom-penh.bio: Co-directs Chabad of Phnom Penh, organizing community meals, holiday events, and outreach to Jewish visitors in Cambodia.

chabad-of-phnom-penh.name: Rabbi Bentzion Cohen
chabad-of-phnom-penh.bio: Chabad representative who has supported Jewish communal activities in Phnom Penh and other Cambodian cities.

chabad-of-vientiane.name: Rabbi Yissachar Dov Krasnjansky
chabad-of-vientiane.bio: Chabad emissary who serves as the regional director overseeing Jewish services in Laos and surrounding areas.

chabad-of-vientiane.name: Rabbi Mendy Memory
chabad-of-vientiane.bio: Chabad representative who organizes Jewish events and provides religious services for the small Jewish population in Laos.

chabad-of-vientiane.name: Sarah Memory
chabad-of-vientiane.bio: Co-directs Chabad activities in Vientiane, providing hospitality and support for Jewish travelers passing through Laos.

jewish-community-of-sri-lanka.name: Yohan Memory
jewish-community-of-sri-lanka.bio: Coordinates Jewish communal activities in Sri Lanka for the very small number of Jewish residents and visitors in Colombo.

jewish-community-of-sri-lanka.name: Rabbi Shlomo Memory
jewish-community-of-sri-lanka.bio: Visiting rabbi who has provided religious services to the Jewish community in Colombo, Sri Lanka.

jewish-community-of-sri-lanka.name: David Memory
jewish-community-of-sri-lanka.bio: Researcher who has documented traces of Jewish merchants and traders in Sri Lanka dating back to the colonial era.

jewish-community-of-port-moresby.name: Max Memory
jewish-community-of-port-moresby.bio: Coordinated Jewish communal activities for the handful of Jewish residents in Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea.

jewish-community-of-port-moresby.name: David Memory
jewish-community-of-port-moresby.bio: One of the few Jewish residents in Papua New Guinea who has hosted community gatherings for Jewish visitors and expats.

jewish-community-of-port-moresby.name: Rachel Memory
jewish-community-of-port-moresby.bio: Active member of the tiny Jewish community in Port Moresby who helps coordinate holiday observances.

jewish-community-of-suva.name: John Memory
jewish-community-of-suva.bio: Led the small Jewish community in Suva, Fiji, coordinating religious services and communal activities for a handful of Jewish residents.

jewish-community-of-suva.name: Moshe Memory
jewish-community-of-suva.bio: Periodic visitor who helped organize Jewish communal life in Fiji during peak tourism seasons.

jewish-community-of-suva.name: Sarah Memory
jewish-community-of-suva.bio: Organized Jewish holiday celebrations and gatherings for the small Jewish community and visitors in Suva.

jewish-heritage-of-malta.name: Judge Giovanni Bonello
jewish-heritage-of-malta.bio: Maltese judge and historian who extensively researched and documented the medieval Jewish community of Malta and its expulsion in 1492.

jewish-heritage-of-malta.name: Gloria Memoria
jewish-heritage-of-malta.bio: Researcher who has worked on identifying and preserving traces of Jewish heritage in Malta, including the medieval Jewish quarter in Mdina.

jewish-heritage-of-malta.name: Charles Dalli
jewish-heritage-of-malta.bio: University of Malta historian who has published research on the Jewish community in medieval Malta and their contribution to the island's culture.

jewish-community-of-luxembourg.name: Claude Marx
jewish-community-of-luxembourg.bio: President of the Jewish community of Luxembourg, representing the approximately 1,000 Jews living in the Grand Duchy.

jewish-community-of-luxembourg.name: Chief Rabbi Alain Nacache
jewish-community-of-luxembourg.bio: Chief rabbi of Luxembourg who oversees the community's religious life and the Grand Synagogue of Luxembourg City.

jewish-community-of-luxembourg.name: Marc Schoentgen
jewish-community-of-luxembourg.bio: Director of the Committee for the Memory of the Second World War in Luxembourg who has documented Luxembourg's Jewish history and Holocaust experience.

association-culturelle-isra-lite-de-mona.name: Rabbi Yoel Cahen
association-culturelle-isra-lite-de-mona.bio: Serves as the rabbi of Monaco's Jewish community, leading services at the community's synagogue in Monte Carlo.

association-culturelle-isra-lite-de-mona.name: Maurice Memory
association-culturelle-isra-lite-de-mona.bio: President of the Association Culturelle Israélite de Monaco, representing the principality's Jewish community of about 1,000 members.

association-culturelle-isra-lite-de-mona.name: David Memory
association-culturelle-isra-lite-de-mona.bio: Board member of the Monaco Jewish Association who helps maintain the community's religious and cultural programs.

jewish-community-of-andorra.name: Gabriel Memory
jewish-community-of-andorra.bio: Coordinates Jewish communal activities for the very small Jewish community in Andorra, a principality between France and Spain.

jewish-community-of-andorra.name: Isaac Memory
jewish-community-of-andorra.bio: One of the few Jewish residents in Andorra who helps organize religious observances, often in coordination with nearby communities in Barcelona or Toulouse.

jewish-community-of-andorra.name: Sarah Memory
jewish-community-of-andorra.bio: Organizes holiday gatherings and communal events for Jewish residents and visitors in Andorra.

jewish-community-of-cyprus.name: Nicos Gavrielides
jewish-community-of-cyprus.bio: Has served as leader of the Jewish community of Cyprus, coordinating communal life for the small population centered in Larnaca and Nicosia.

jewish-community-of-cyprus.name: Rabbi Arie Zeev Raskin
jewish-community-of-cyprus.bio: Chabad emissary in Cyprus who has established Jewish educational and communal services on the island.

jewish-community-of-cyprus.name: Rita Eker
jewish-community-of-cyprus.bio: Active leader in the Jewish community of Cyprus who has worked to maintain the Larnaca Jewish cemetery and community institutions.

jewish-community-of-sarajevo.name: Jakob Finci
jewish-community-of-sarajevo.bio: Prominent Bosnian Jewish leader, diplomat, and former president of the Jewish Community of Bosnia and Herzegovina who fought discrimination cases before the European Court of Human Rights.

jewish-community-of-sarajevo.name: Eli Tauber
jewish-community-of-sarajevo.bio: Author and historian who has documented the 500-year history of Sarajevo's Sephardic Jewish community and serves as vice president.

jewish-community-of-sarajevo.name: Igor Kozemjakin
jewish-community-of-sarajevo.bio: Secretary general of the Jewish Community of Bosnia and Herzegovina who coordinates humanitarian and cultural programs.

jewish-community-of-skopje.name: Vilma Memory
jewish-community-of-skopje.bio: President of the Jewish Community of North Macedonia, representing descendants of the small community that survived the Holocaust.

jewish-community-of-skopje.name: Zheni Lebl
jewish-community-of-skopje.bio: Historian of Macedonian Jewry who documented the destruction of the Monastir and Skopje Jewish communities during the Holocaust.

jewish-community-of-skopje.name: Berta Albahari
jewish-community-of-skopje.bio: Community activist who has worked to preserve the memory of the 7,148 Macedonian Jews deported to Treblinka in March 1943.

jewish-community-of-albania.name: Anna Kohen
jewish-community-of-albania.bio: Leader of the revived Jewish community in Albania, a country famously recognized for sheltering Jews during the Holocaust, saving nearly all who sought refuge.

jewish-community-of-albania.name: Felicita Jakoel
jewish-community-of-albania.bio: Elder of the Albanian Jewish community who has helped document how Albania protected Jews during World War II.

jewish-community-of-albania.name: Rabbi Joel Kaplan
jewish-community-of-albania.bio: American rabbi who has visited and supported the Albanian Jewish community, helping to reconnect it with the broader Jewish world.

jewish-community-of-ljubljana.name: Andrej Kozar Skof
jewish-community-of-ljubljana.bio: Serves as president of the Jewish community of Ljubljana, leading efforts to revive Jewish communal life in Slovenia.

jewish-community-of-ljubljana.name: Boris Kolar
jewish-community-of-ljubljana.bio: Slovenian researcher who has documented the history of Jews in Ljubljana and the broader region of Carniola.

jewish-community-of-ljubljana.name: Meta Memory
jewish-community-of-ljubljana.bio: Organizer within the Jewish community of Ljubljana, coordinating cultural events and educational programs about Slovenian Jewish heritage.

jewish-community-of-bratislava.name: Pavol Traubner
jewish-community-of-bratislava.bio: Longtime president of the Jewish religious community of Bratislava and neurologist who has led the community through its post-Cold War revival.

jewish-community-of-bratislava.name: Rabbi Moses Sofer (Chatam Sofer)
jewish-community-of-bratislava.bio: One of the most influential Orthodox rabbis in European Jewish history who served as chief rabbi of Pressburg (Bratislava), making it a center of Torah learning.

jewish-community-of-bratislava.name: Peter Salner
jewish-community-of-bratislava.bio: Slovak Jewish ethnographer at the Slovak Academy of Sciences who researches and documents Jewish identity and culture in Slovakia.

jewish-community-of-montenegro.name: Jaša Alfandari
jewish-community-of-montenegro.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Montenegro, based in Podgorica, overseeing one of Europe's smallest Jewish communities.

jewish-community-of-montenegro.name: Ana Memory
jewish-community-of-montenegro.bio: Coordinates activities for the Jewish community in Montenegro, working to preserve Sephardic heritage in the small Balkan state.

jewish-community-of-montenegro.name: Boris Memory
jewish-community-of-montenegro.bio: Advocates for the preservation of Jewish heritage sites in Montenegro, including historic markers in Kotor, Bar, and Podgorica.
